citation.case_name: Southern R. Co. v. United States

html:
355 U.S. 370

78 S.Ct. 364

2 L.Ed.2d 352

SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY and the Cincinnati, New Orleans and Texas Pacific Railway Company, appellants,
v.
UNITED STATES of America et al.

No. 579.

Supreme Court of the United States

January 13, 1958

Messrs. Henry L. Walker, Arthur J. Dixon, James A. Bistline and R. Granville Curry, for appellants.

Messrs. John W. Adams, Jr., Charles P. Reynolds, R. B. Claytor, Martin A. Meyer, Jr., and Walter C. Scott, Jr., for appellees Atlanta & St. Andrews Bay Railway Co. and others.

Messrs. John S. Burchmore and Robert N. Burchmore, for appellee Cramet Inc.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motions to affirm are granted and the judgment is affirmed.
html_lawbox:
355 U.S. 370 (1958)

SOUTHERN RAILWAY CO. ET AL.
v.
UNITED STATES ET AL.

No. 579.

Supreme Court of United States.

Decided January 13, 1958.
APPEAL FROM THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF VIRGINIA.

Henry L. Walker, Arthur J. Dixon, James A. Bistline and R. Granville Curry for appellants.

John W. Adams, Jr., Charles P. Reynolds, R. B. Claytor, Martin A. Meyer, Jr. and Walter C. Scott, Jr. for the Atlanta & St. Andrews Bay Railway Co. et al., and John S. Burchmore and Robert N. Burchmore for Cramet Inc., appellees.

PER CURIAM.

The motions to affirm are granted and the judgment is affirmed.
